channel.title: Home on Tyler Rinkol's Website
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Tyler Rinkol's Website

item.title: Which Nebraska QB is the greatest QB in the last 37 years?
item.description: With the spring game coming up, it’s getting me in the mood for Nebraska football. There was a lot of controversy last year about the quarterback position and who should start. The quarterback is the most important position on the field and is very important for Husker fans since the expectations are so high for each team every year. So I started to think: Who is greatest QB Nebraska has had in the last 37 years?

item.title: Are the 2017 Golden State Warriors the best team in the past 20 years?
item.description: NBA fans have argued for years, “who is the best NBA team ever?” Some could argue that it could be the 1995 Chicago Bulls or 2016 Golden State Warriors. However, this argument is very hard to prove. A more realistic argument would be to look at what the best teams are in the modern era, more specifically from 2000 to 2021. When you think of today’s basketball, you may think of good shooting and superstars dominating the game.

item.title: Text Cleaning
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.5 ✓ dplyr 1.0.3 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.draw.absoluteGrob ggplot2 ## grobHeight.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: About Hugo Ivy
item.description: This Hugo theme was ported from Ivy, a minimalist website generator built in Python. I don’t have time to document this theme. You have to read the source code to understand what it can do. All I can say for now is that I love it. It is clean, minimal, and responsive. I hope you will enjoy this theme. The source code is on Github. Happy hacking!

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.
